p: Inka Santala is an urban geographer and a PhD Candidate at the School of Geography and Sustainable Communities, University of Wollongong. Her research explores the perceptions of agency and the dynamics of social change in cities. Drawing from the thinking of transformative social innovation and diverse economies, her current project seeks to understand the citizen subjectivities and collective capacities embedded in community-based sharing. She is a member of the Community Economies Research Network.
